name: Black Tea
description: Black tea is fully oxidized, giving it a dark color and rich, bold flavor. It has a higher caffeine content compared to other teas.

name: Green Tea
description: Green tea is minimally oxidized, resulting in a light, grassy flavor. It is known for its high antioxidant content and potential health benefits.

name: Oolong Tea
description: Oolong tea is partially oxidized, offering a flavor profile that falls between black and green tea. It can be floral, fruity, or toasty, depending on the level of oxidation.

name: White Tea
description: White tea is the least processed of all teas, made from young leaves and buds. It has a delicate, subtle flavor and is rich in antioxidants.

name: Herbal Tea
description: Herbal tea, also known as a tisane, is made from various herbs, flowers, and fruits. It is naturally caffeine-free and comes in a wide range of flavors.

name: Pu-erh Tea
description: Pu-erh tea is a fermented tea with a deep, earthy flavor. It is aged over time and is often enjoyed for its rich, complex taste.

name: Matcha Tea
description: Matcha is a type of powdered green tea, made from shade-grown tea leaves. It has a vibrant green color, a rich umami flavor, and is packed with antioxidants.
